metadata.synopsis: Isobel's default dialog in HAV. Varies greatly depending on the state of HAV and what the player has discovered in Moonrise or Shar Temple.
metadata.how_to_trigger: This dialog becomes available typically after a few other dialogues took place, mainly BriefAtLake and BriefInRoom + SpyCapture.

39.speaker: Isobel
39.text: You did well to help those people escape Ketheric. Every soul saved is a blessing, and you're raining them upon us.
39.context: NodeContext: A little cheeky. She's sincere, but saying this with a little wink too

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Isobel. I found the empty sarcophagus of an Isobel Thorm - Ketheric's daughter.

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *Her breath catches; you notice a barely-perceptible shudder run through her body.*

74.speaker: Isobel
74.text: An unfortunate coincidence. I hope never to meet the wicked man who haemorrhaged shadows over this peaceful village.

42.speaker: Isobel
42.text: May we be lucky enough to see many more.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: Still plenty to do to stop Ketheric.

47.speaker: Isobel
47.text: True enough. I won't keep you - but I'm glad to see these people looking so well.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I saw Ketheric at Moonrise Towers. He was presiding over a trial.

92.speaker: Isobel
92.text: Almost laughable, that he sees himself fit to judge anyone.

173.speaker: Isobel
173.text: Did you learn anything about how we might defeat him?

163.speaker: Player
163.text: I think I know the source of his invulnerability: a relic called the Nightsong.

105.speaker: Isobel
105.text: That's incredible news. I won't ask for specifics as to how you uncovered that... but I'm grateful you've done whatever it takes.

11.speaker: Isobel
11.text: I can't believe there's an end in sight. Thank you.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: I still have a few questions.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: Why has the Moonmaiden waited until now to take an interest in this curse?

148.speaker: Isobel
148.text: Maybe she was waiting for one of us to find this place ourselves. Free will, and all that.

107.speaker: Isobel
107.text: Though if it were my place to ask why she let Ketheric turn; why she allowed this village to rot at his hands - believe me, I would.
107.context: NodeContext: A cold edge in her voice

113.speaker: Player
113.text: This curse seems incredibly powerful. What more can you tell me about it?

162.speaker: Isobel
162.text: It belongs to the goddess Shar - according to the Harpers, it fell here when they defeated Ketheric - the one who tried to have me kidnapped.

143.speaker: Isobel
143.text: I suppose they didn't defeat him quite hard enough.

146.speaker: Isobel
146.text: It belongs to the goddess Shar - according to the Harpers, it fell here when they defeated - or thought they defeated - one of her disciples, Ketheric Thorm.

139.speaker: Isobel
139.text: It's incredibly powerful. We'll have our work cut out for us trying to shift the thing, but I believe we - you - can do it.
139.context: NodeContext: She knows a lot more than she's letting on. This is her father, and he resurrected her.

177.speaker: Player
177.text: How did you come to this place?

68.speaker: Isobel
68.text: Right place, right time. When a cleric of Selûne stumbles into a Sharran shadow, she's bound to set it to rights - at any cost.
68.context: NodeContext: A bit wry. She's being very sarcastic but doesn't want to reveal her hand to the player

94.speaker: Player
94.text: I don't know much about you. Care to fill in the blanks?

189.speaker: Isobel
189.text: I could say the same. But perhaps we should save the trivia 'til we're on the other side of this thing.

120.speaker: Isobel
120.text: Promise not to die, and we'll celebrate with our life stories.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I'm not overly familiar with Selûne and Shar. Could you enlighten me?

126.speaker: Isobel
126.text: Moon and shadow - light and dark. Divine sisters, ever at war. And this place has become one more battlefield.

29.speaker: Isobel
29.text: Sometimes life forces us to choose sides. Luckily, sometimes the choice is obvious.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Not yet, but I think I'm on the right track.

134.speaker: Isobel
134.text: I'm glad you've made progress. Protecting this inn - well, it takes it out of you. I'll hold out as long as I can. By the sound of things, we'll have a more permanent solution soon.

118.speaker: Isobel
118.text: So glad you're on our side.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: You'll know when I've found anything.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: I found the source of Ketheric's immortality - an immortal from whom he draws power. She's been taken back to Moonrise Towers.

112.speaker: Isobel
112.text: An immortal. But it couldn't possibly be...
112.context: NodeContext: She thinks this referse to Aylin (she's right) but is trying not to show it.

164.speaker: Isobel
164.text: Your mission is more urgent than ever. I can hardly fathom what Ketheric has become. Free the immortal - and stop him. Please.
164.context: NodeContext: urgent, desperation in her voice as she realizes it might be Nightsong

40.speaker: Isobel
40.text: Like most things in life. My thanks to your team. You work well together.

76.speaker: Isobel
76.text: There you are. What's happening out there? Who was that, streaking across the sky?

144.speaker: Player
144.text: Isobel. I found the empty sarcophagus of an Isobel Thorm - Ketheric's daughter.

19.speaker: Narrator
19.text: *Her breath catches; you notice a barely-perceptible shudder run through her body.*

155.speaker: Isobel
155.text: An unfortunate coincidence. I hope never to meet the wicked man who haemorrhaged shadows over this peaceful village.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: Her name is Nightsong. An immortal Ketheric had trapped within the Shadowfell.

20.speaker: Isobel
20.text: An immortal. But... it couldn't possibly be... never mind. It doesn't matter. What matters is you have him in a corner.
20.context: NodeContext: Wondering if Nightsong could possibly be her girlfriend Aylin

58.speaker: Isobel
58.text: Jaheira and every fighting body in this place have gone to Moonrise Towers to face Ketheric down. She's waiting for you there.

3.speaker: Isobel
3.text: End this. Now. We're all counting on you.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Whoever she is, she's got a serious bone to pick with Ketheric.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Attack her. The Urge aches for it.

85.speaker: Isobel
85.text: On with you. Unless you want to come back to a gaggle of shadow-cursed Harpers.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Isobel. I found the empty sarcophagus of an Isobel Thorm - Ketheric's daughter.

166.speaker: Narrator
166.text: *Her breath catches; you notice a barely-perceptible shudder run through her body.*

186.speaker: Isobel
186.text: An unfortunate coincidence. I hope never to meet the wicked man who haemorrhaged shadows over this peaceful village.

190.speaker: Isobel
190.text: Don't jest. We're all closer to oblivion than you might think. And when we're gone, there'll be no one left to stop Ketheric.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I have news about Ketheric. I've been tasked with retrieving something important to him - seems like a good lead.

124.speaker: Narrator
124.text: *Every scrap of your marrow yearns to end her. Dooming the village would bring foul glory. You can almost taste it.*

93.speaker: Narrator
93.text: *This is the one Sceleritas sent you to kill. Every scrap of your marrow yearns to end her.*

161.speaker: Isobel
161.context: NodeContext: A little cheeky. She's sincere, but saying this with a little wink too

174.speaker: Isobel
174.text: Hold - who are you, and what are you doing here?
174.context: NodeContext: She hasn't met the player before. Suspicious.

127.speaker: Narrator
127.text: *Your body yearns to kill this cleric, more than anything else. You know it, deep down, in your writhing intestines.*

104.speaker: Player
104.text: My blood... it's telling me to kill you.

103.speaker: Narrator
103.text: *She doesn't believe you will do it. You can see, she wants to believe there is mercy in all, even in the worst.*

194.speaker: Isobel
194.text: You aren't the first to threaten me. But I know the eyes of a killer when I see them. You mean me no harm. Do you? An experienced cleric can tell such things.

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: *The Urge within does not want to talk. The restless Urge starts to scream.*

10.speaker: Player
10.text: BASH YOU! EAT YOU! FLAY! FLAY!

169.speaker: Isobel
169.text: Moonmaiden - have mercy on this poor soul.
169.context: NodeContext: She's preparing to fight, but can see the DU is afflicted. Last line before the battle begins, so harsh, but not furious.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: Your blood is my offering, my oblation, my gift.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Retreat into your mind. Fester in the Urges.

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *The moment you even began to think of it, it was already over.*

185.speaker: Narrator
185.text: *As suddenly as it started, you have tamed the Urge. It slumbers again.*

90.speaker: Isobel
90.text: There we are. The real you. Your - affliction, is it? - doesn't rule you, does it.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I'm not going to follow my order. You will live.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I'm cursed with spells of madness, forgive me what I said.

133.speaker: Isobel
133.text: Why don't we try again, then? Who are you?

21.speaker: Isobel
21.text: Let things begin again, as long as you keep the peace in Last Light.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: I won't harm you... I don't know what came over me.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I am going to save these lands. I- I mean you no harm.

168.speaker: Isobel
168.text: You'd be a bit late to the party if you did. Ketheric Thorm done for. Or didn't you see that angel carving a path straight toward Moonrise Towers?

73.speaker: Player
73.text: In fact, I'm the one who set her free.

145.speaker: Isobel
145.text: I've a great number of questions for you, in that case. But those can wait until Ketheric is dead. While he lives, we're all on borrowed time.

6.speaker: Isobel
6.text: Our fighting forces led by the Harpers have gone straight to the Towers to face Ketheric down.

5.speaker: Isobel
5.text: Curious though you may be, if you're an enemy to Ketheric, you can take your rest here.

106.speaker: Isobel
106.text: Rest here, if you need. Then finish this. None of us will be safe while Ketheric is alive.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: I did. And I'm on my way to the Towers now to see Ketheric finished.

175.speaker: Isobel
175.text: In that case... you're very welcome here. But I urge you to be careful. Ketheric is a dangerous man. His devotion to the so-called 'Absolute' has taken whatever nobility of soul remained to him.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I could ask you the same.

183.speaker: Isobel
183.text: I'm Isobel. Servant of the Moonmaiden. Protector of this inn and those who seek shelter here. Your turn.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I'm the one who freed the aasimar who carved a path of light through the shadow curse.

17.speaker: Isobel
17.text: I saw them flying - the path of light. They seemed headed straight for Moonrise Towers.
17.context: NodeContext: A hint of curiosity in her voice; she's wondering if this could possibly be Aylin, but it makes no sense.

182.speaker: Isobel
182.text: This might all be over soon. But Ketheric won't go down easily.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I'm the one who freed those prisoners from Moonrise and brought them here.

15.speaker: Isobel
15.text: That was quite the feat. It'd be hard enough to get into the Towers unshackled, much less getting back out.

181.speaker: Isobel
181.text: If you've done it once, no doubt you can do it again. While Ketheric lives, we're all on borrowed time.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: I'll put an end to him - to all of this.

43.speaker: Isobel
43.text: Call me mad, but I believe you.

115.speaker: Isobel
115.text: I have my reasons. And anyway - there are civilians to protect. Without me, this inn would fall to shadow.

89.speaker: Isobel
89.text: This could all be over soon. If you can lend a hand at the Towers, I hope you will.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I mean you no harm.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: Isobel. I found the empty sarcophagus of an Isobel Thorm - Ketheric's daughter.

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *Her breath catches; you notice a barely-perceptible shudder run through her body.*

66.speaker: Isobel
66.text: An unfortunate coincidence. I hope never to meet the wicked man who haemorrhaged shadows over this peaceful village. I pray only for his end.

188.speaker: Isobel
188.text: Don't let Jaheira catch you dawdling.

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *There is something about her... it would be wonderful to kill her. A perfect tragedy.*

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Isobel. I found the empty sarcophagus of an Isobel Thorm - Ketheric's daughter.
